name: Ext_R4B_MolecularSequence_variant
title: Cross-version Extension for R4B.MolecularSequence.variant for use in FHIR R5
description: This cross-version extension represents MolecularSequence.variant from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/MolecularSequence|4.3.0 for use in FHIR R5.

element.definition: The definition of variant here originates from Sequence ontology ([variant_of](http://www.sequenceontology.org/browser/current_svn/term/variant_of)). This element can represent amino acid or nucleic sequence change(including insertion,deletion,SNP,etc.)  It can represent some complex mutation or segment variation with the assist of CIGAR string.
element.comment: `MolecularSequence.variant` has no related element in R5:MolecularSequence

element.short: Start position of the variant on the  reference sequence
element.definition: Start position of the variant on the  reference sequence. If the coordinate system is either 0-based or 1-based, then start position is inclusive.
element.comment: `MolecularSequence.variant` has no related element in R5:MolecularSequence

element.short: Start position of the variant on the  reference sequence
element.definition: Start position of the variant on the  reference sequence. If the coordinate system is either 0-based or 1-based, then start position is inclusive.
element.comment: `MolecularSequence.variant` has no related element in R5:MolecularSequence

element.short: End position of the variant on the reference sequence
element.definition: End position of the variant on the reference sequence. If the coordinate system is 0-based then end is exclusive and does not include the last position. If the coordinate system is 1-base, then end is inclusive and includes the last position.
element.comment: `MolecularSequence.variant` has no related element in R5:MolecularSequence

element.short: End position of the variant on the reference sequence
element.definition: End position of the variant on the reference sequence. If the coordinate system is 0-based then end is exclusive and does not include the last position. If the coordinate system is 1-base, then end is inclusive and includes the last position.
element.comment: `MolecularSequence.variant` has no related element in R5:MolecularSequence

element.definition: An allele is one of a set of coexisting sequence variants of a gene ([SO:0001023](http://www.sequenceontology.org/browser/current_svn/term/SO:0001023)).  Nucleotide(s)/amino acids from start position of sequence to stop position of sequence on the positive (+) strand of the observed  sequence. When the sequence  type is DNA, it should be the sequence on the positive (+) strand. This will lay in the range between variant.start and variant.end.
element.comment: `MolecularSequence.variant` has no related element in R5:MolecularSequence

element.definition: An allele is one of a set of coexisting sequence variants of a gene ([SO:0001023](http://www.sequenceontology.org/browser/current_svn/term/SO:0001023)).  Nucleotide(s)/amino acids from start position of sequence to stop position of sequence on the positive (+) strand of the observed  sequence. When the sequence  type is DNA, it should be the sequence on the positive (+) strand. This will lay in the range between variant.start and variant.end.
element.comment: `MolecularSequence.variant` has no related element in R5:MolecularSequence

Nucleotide(s)/amino acids from start position of sequence to stop position of sequence on the positive (+) strand of the reference sequence. When the sequence  type is DNA, it should be the sequence on the positive (+) strand. This will lay in the range between variant.start and variant.end.

Nucleotide(s)/amino acids from start position of sequence to stop position of sequence on the positive (+) strand of the reference sequence. When the sequence  type is DNA, it should be the sequence on the positive (+) strand. This will lay in the range between variant.start and variant.end.

element.short: Extended CIGAR string for aligning the sequence with reference bases
element.definition: Extended CIGAR string for aligning the sequence with reference bases. See detailed documentation [here](http://support.illumina.com/help/SequencingAnalysisWorkflow/Content/Vault/Informatics/Sequencing_Analysis/CASAVA/swSEQ_mCA_ExtendedCIGARFormat.htm).
element.comment: `MolecularSequence.variant` has no related element in R5:MolecularSequence

element.definition: Extended CIGAR string for aligning the sequence with reference bases. See detailed documentation [here](http://support.illumina.com/help/SequencingAnalysisWorkflow/Content/Vault/Informatics/Sequencing_Analysis/CASAVA/swSEQ_mCA_ExtendedCIGARFormat.htm).
element.comment: `MolecularSequence.variant` has no related element in R5:MolecularSequence

element.definition: A pointer to an Observation containing variant information.
element.comment: `MolecularSequence.variant` has no related element in R5:MolecularSequence
